content.title: Endovascular Aneurysm Repair (EVAR)
content.definition: Minimally invasive endovascular repair of abdominal aortic aneurysm using a stent-graft deployed via femoral access.

concepts.definition: Anatomic requirements for standard EVAR eligibility based on instructions for use (IFU).

clinical_features.distal_landing: Common iliac >20mm length, EIA if hypogastric coiling

concepts.definition: Key procedural steps for standard EVAR.

adjuncts: Embolization of hypogastric if landing in EIA

imaging: CT at 1 month, 12 months, then annually
endoleak_monitoring: Type I and III require reintervention
Type II observed if sac stable

clinical_features.anesthesia: General, regional, or local with sedation

diagnostic_criteria.technical_success: Stent-graft deployment without type I/III endoleak

content.statement: Endovascular Aneurysm Repair (EVAR) is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Endovascular that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
